text: The 1924 France–Belgium women's athletics match was an international women's athletics match where a national team of female French athletes competed against a national team of Belgian athletes. It took place on 17 August 1924 at Stade Demeny in Douai, France. During the competition two world records were broken. The competition was won by France with 66.5 points ahead of Belgium with 40.5 points. ==Background== The event took place in the early era of international women's athletics. Annualy since 1921, tt was the the fourth time a match was held between France and Belgium. ==Competition== ===50 metres=== Place Athlete Time Points Note 1 10.8 sec 2 +15 cm 3 +1 m 4 ===Shot put=== The score was the total of a throw with the right arm and with the left arm. Place Athlete Right arm Left arm Total Points Note 1 10.21 m 9.495 m 19.705 m 2 9.19 m 8.03 m 17.22 m 3 16.54 m 4 13.67 m ===Long jump=== Place Athlete Distance Points Note 1 5.03 m NR 2 4.97 m 3 4.91 m 4 4.895 m ===83 metres hurdles=== Belgian Henriette Vandaelen and French Geneviève Laloz had an extremely emotional fight for second place and both crossed the finished at the same time. Place Athlete Time Points Note 1 14.2 sec NR 2 + 2m 2 + 2m 4 ===Javelin throw=== The score was the total of a throw with the right arm and with the left arm. Place Athlete Right arm Left arm Distance Points Note 1 23.93 m 18.98 m 42.91 m 2 23.82 m 17.30 m 41.12 m 3 34.55 m 4 32.43 m ===High jump=== Place Athlete Height Points Note 1 1.40 m 2 1.35 m 3 1.35 m 4 1.30 m ===Discus throw=== Place Athlete Distance Points Note 1 28.39 m 2 25.25 m 3 22.92 m 4 20.76 m ===1000 metres=== Place Athlete Time Points Note 1 3:19.6 2 +6 m 3 +1 m \- DNF ===4 x 200 metres relay=== It was reported that the French team had an easy victory over the Belgian team. Place Team Time Points 1 Marguerite Radideau Georgette Gagneux Geneviève Laloz Germaine Darreau 1:57.2 2 Elise Van Truyen Vandenbroeck Louise Gits Antoinette Gallemaers ==Overall classification== The intermediate score after the javelin throw was France: 42.5 points, Belgium 23.5 points.
